name: Brazil Nuts
properties: Extremely rich in selenium (one nut provides daily requirement)
Contains healthy monounsaturated and polyunsaturated fats
Good source of magnesium, copper, and zinc
Provides vitamin E and other antioxidants
Has unique creamy texture and mild flavor
Can be ground into a parmesan-like topping
benefits: Provides exceptional selenium content for thyroid function
Supports immune system with high selenium and zinc
Contains antioxidants that protect against oxidative stress
Promotes heart health with healthy fats
Supports brain health and cognitive function
Aids in satiety and weight management
synergies: Combines with cashews in Brazil Nut Parm topping
Pairs with nutritional yeast for cheesy flavor profile
Complements pasta dishes and whole grains
Works well with vegetables for nutrient absorption
amount: 1-3 nuts per day (due to high selenium content, do not exceed 3-4 nuts daily)

quotes: Divide the pasta among shallow serving bowls or plates and serve hot, topped with the Brazil Nut Parm to taste, basil, and black pepper to taste.
BRAZIL NUT PARM - MAKES: 1½ cups/200g - The recipe calls for Brazil nuts and cashews... ¾ cup/100g raw Brazil nuts, ¼ cup/40g raw cashews
